ai:cl.c: Extends the Vector class with support for generating custom paths.

ai:a.c: Flush buffered data from an object.

ai:m.c: Add one or more commands to the end of the path sequence.
ai:m.p: ERR vp::AddCommand(OBJECTPTR Object, struct PathCommand * Commands, INT Size)

ai:i.c: Array of commands to add to the path.
The size of the Commands buffer, in bytes.

ai:m.c: Retrieve a specific command from the path sequence.
ai:m.p: ERR vp::GetCommand(OBJECTPTR Object, INT Index, struct PathCommand ** Command)

ai:i.c: The index of the command to retrieve.
The requested command will be returned in this parameter.

ai:m.c: Remove at least one command from the path sequence.
ai:m.p: ERR vp::RemoveCommand(OBJECTPTR Object, INT Index, INT Total)

ai:i.c: The index of the command to remove.
The total number of commands to remove, starting from the given Index.

ai:m.c: Copies one or more commands into an existing path.
ai:m.p: ERR vp::SetCommand(OBJECTPTR Object, INT Index, struct PathCommand * Command, INT Size)

ai:i.c: The index of the command that is to be set.
An array of commands to set in the path.
The size of the Command buffer, in bytes.

ai:m.c: The fastest available mechanism for setting a series of path instructions.
ai:m.p: ERR vp::SetCommandList(OBJECTPTR Object, APTR Commands, INT Size)

ai:i.c: The byte size of the Commands buffer.

ai:f.c: Direct pointer to the PathCommand array.
Calibrates the user agent's distance-along-a-path calculations with that of the author.
A sequence of points and instructions that will define the path.
The total number of points defined in the path sequence.
